com.ucsf.core.data

Class DataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ucsf.core.data.AbstractConnection
      • com.ucsf.core.data.DataManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DataManager
extends AbstractConnection
    Class allowing data storage. It uses a SQLite database as internal storage. Multiple connections to the database are allowed and its usage of this wrapper is thread safe. See the method get() to have an example on how to use a database connection.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DataManager.Condition
      Abstract class describing a condition to satisfy when fetching the database.
      static class  DataManager.Cursor
      Class allowing to iterate through requested entries.
      class  DataManager.Table
      Class representing a database table.
      static class  DataManager.TableField
      Representation of a table field.
      static class  DataManager.Type
      Enumeration od the possible field types in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static DataManager get(Context context)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an opened connection to the database.
        The typical way to use such a connection is the following: 

         
      try (DataManager instance = DataManager.open(context)) {
          // Perform operations on the database
      } catch (Exception e) {
          // Handle eventual exceptions
      }

        By this way, the connection is automatically closed no matter what.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • openConnection

        protected void openConnection(Context context)
        Description copied from class: AbstractConnection
        Opens the underlying connection. Should never be called directly, use open() instead.
        Specified by:
        openConnection in class AbstractConnection

      • closeConnection

        protected void closeConnection()
        Description copied from class: AbstractConnection
        Closes the underlying connection. Should never be called directly, use close() instead.
        Specified by:
        closeConnection in class AbstractConnection

      • getTable

        public static DataManager.Table getTable(java.lang.String tag)
        Returns the database table register under the given tag.

      • getTables

        public static DataManager.Table[] getTables()
        Returns an array containing all the registered tables. Because the application has several entry points, this list may not be exhaustive.

      • createTable

        public DataManager.Table createTable(java.lang.String tag,
                                     DeviceLocation location,
                                     DataManager.TableField... fields)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new database table using the provided information.
        Parameters:
        tag - Unique identifier of the table.
        location - Specify from which device this table is coming.
        fields - List of the table fields. See DataManager.TableField for more details.
        Returns:
        Returns the new created table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • fetchAndAdd

        public boolean fetchAndAdd(java.lang.String tag,
                           Entry[] conditions,
                           Entry... entries)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Fetches if the given entries exist. If true, update them. Otherwise add them. identified by the given id. See DataManager.Table.fetchAndAdd(Entry[] conditions, Entry... entries) for more details.
        Parameters:
        tag - Unique identifier of the table.
        Returns:
        Returns if the operation is successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
